q1.description: A set is a collection of distinguishable members or elements. There is no concept of duplication in a set.
q1.question: [T/F]Sets may contain duplicate elements.

q2.description: A set is a collection of distinguishable members or elements. There is no concept of duplication in a set.
q2.question: Let $P = \{7,11,42\}$, Which of the following is correct?

q3.description: Set members are typically drawn from some larger population known as the base type
q3.question: Let $P = \{7, 11, 42\}$, what is the base type of $P$ elements?

q4.description: Each member of a set is either a primitive element of the base type or is a set itself.
q4.question: Let $P = \{a, b, c, \{d, e\}, \{f\}\}$. Which of the followings are an element in the set.

q5.description: Sets common symbols: a) $\{\}$: braces that surround the set elements.
q5.question: Which of the following is a valid set?

q6.description: Sets common symbols: b) $\{x|x\ is\ a\ positive\ integer\}$: A set definition using a set format
q6.question: Choose what best explain previous set.

q7.description: Sets common symbols: c) $x∈P$: $x$ is a member of set $P$ d) $x∉P$: $x$ is not a member of set $P$
q7.question: Let $P = \{a, b, c\}$, which of the following is $∉P$?

q8.description: Sets common symbols: e) ∅: The null or empty set
q8.question: Which of the following is $∈Q$?
choices: $Q\ has\ no\ elements\ because\ it\ is\ the\ null\ set.$

q9.description: Set's common symbols: f) $|P|$: Cardinality: the size of set $P$ or number of members for set $P$
q9.question: What does it mean to say that $|P|$ = $3$?

q10.description: Sets common symbols: g) $P⊆Q$, $Q⊇P$: Set $P$ is included in set $Q$, set $P$ is a subset of set $Q$, or set $Q$ is a superset of the set $P$
q10.question: Let $P = \{x|x\ is\ a\ positive\ integer\}$. Which of the following is a subset of $P$?

q11.description: Sets common symbols: i) $P∪Q$:  Union: all elements appearing in $P$ OR $Q$
q11.question: Let $P = \{1, 3, 5\}$, and $Q = \{2, 4, 5, 6\}$ What is $P∪Q$?

q12.description: Sets common symbols: i) $P∪Q$:  Union: all elements appearing in $P$ OR $Q$
q12.question: Let $P = \{1, 3, 5\}$, and $Q = \{2, 4, 5, 6\}$ What is $Q∪P$?

q13.description: Sets common symbol: i) $P∪Q$:  Union: all elements appearing in $P$ OR $Q$
q13.question: Select the correct fact about set union

q14.description: Sets common symbols: j) $P∩Q$: Intersection: all elements appearing in $P$ AND $Q$
q14.question: Let $P = \{1, 3, 5\}$, and $Q = \{2, 4, 5, 6\}$ What is P∩Q?

q15.description: Sets common symbols: j) $P∩Q$: Intersection: all elements appearing in $P$ AND $Q$
q15.question: Let $P = \{1, 3, 5\}$, and $Q = \{2, 4, 5, 6\}$. What is $P∩Q$

q16.description: Sets common symbols: i) $P∩Q$:  Intersection: all elements appearing in $P$ AND $Q$
q16.question: Select the correct fact about set union

q17.description: Sets common symbols: k) $P$ $-$ $Q$: difference: all elements of set $P$ NOT in set $Q$
q17.question: Let $P = \{1, 3, 5\}$, and $Q = \{2, 4, 5, 6\}$ What is $P-Q$?

q18.description: Sets common symbols: k) $P$ $-$ $Q$: difference: all elements of set $P$ NOT in set $Q$
q18.question: Let $P$ = $\{1, 3, 5\}$, and $Q = \{2, 4, 5, 6\}$ What is $Q-P?$

q19.description: Sets common symbols: k) $P$ $-$ $Q$: difference: all elements of set $P$ NOT in set $Q$
q19.question: Select the correct fact about the set difference:

q20.description: Sets common symbols: k) $P$ $x$ $Q$: Set (Cartesian) Product: yields a set of ordered pairs
q20.question: Let $P = \{1, 3, 5\}$, and $Q = \{2, 4\}$ What is $PxQ$?

q21.description: Sets common symbols: k) $P$ $x$ $Q$: Set (Cartesian) Product: yields a set of ordered pairs
q21.question: Let $P = \{1, 3, 5\}$, and $Q = \{2, 4\}$ What is $|PxQ|$?

q22.description: The powerset of a set $S$ (denoted $2S$ ) is the set of all possible subsets for $S$
q22.question: Consider the set $S = \{a,b,c\}$. What is $2^S$?
